conclusion: Predicting Liquid Flow Paths: Analyze how liquid flows from the top containers (A, B, C, D) to the bottom containers (E, F, G) by examining the three images provided.

Understanding the Setup: The images show a board with colored markers at the top (A, B, C, D) and bottom (E, F, G), several angled baffle elements (colored bars) in the middle, and three stages of the experiment showing the flow paths.

Initial State (Image 1): The top has containers labeled A (blue), B (yellow), C (green), D (orange). The bottom has containers labeled E (yellow), F (brown), and G (blue). Between them are several angled baffles that will redirect the flow.
Flow Paths (Images 2 and 3): From Container A (Blue at top) - In image 2, the blue liquid from A flows down and hits the blue horizontal baffle and gets redirected to the left.
Flow Paths (Images 2 and 3): In image 3, the blue liquid continues along with yellow and green liquids. The combined flow follows a path that eventually reaches container E (yellow).
Flow Paths (Images 2 and 3): From Container B (Yellow at top) - The yellow liquid flows downward and combines with the flow from A and C.
Flow Paths (Images 2 and 3): The combined liquid (showing as yellow-green-blue mixture in image 3) flows toward container E.
Flow Paths (Images 2 and 3): From Container C (Green at top) - The green liquid flows downward and joins with the flow from A and B.
Flow Paths (Images 2 and 3): This combined liquid reaches container E (yellow).
Flow Paths (Images 2 and 3): From Container D (Orange at top) - In image 2, the orange liquid flows down and hits the angled grey baffle and gets redirected.
Flow Paths (Images 2 and 3): In image 3, the orange liquid appears to flow along the right side and following its path, it reaches container G (blue) at the bottom right.

premise: Based on the visual evidence from all three images.
conclusion: Liquid from A (blue) → Container E (yellow), Liquid from B (yellow) → Container E (yellow), Liquid from C (green) → Container E (yellow), Liquid from D (orange) → Container G (blue). Container F (brown) does not appear to receive liquid from any of the top containers in this experiment.
